ai.summary: A gentle 4.8 km circuit near Hawker's Hut in North Cornwall, offering easy terrain and scenic countryside suitable for families, casual walkers, and beginners seeking a relaxed day out in the UK countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows well-maintained farm tracks and public footpaths with a mix of grassy fields and compact earth. Expect some uneven sections and occasional muddy patches after rain. There are gentle gradients and occasional steps near the hut; surface can be uneven underfoot, so sturdy footwear is recommended. The scenery includes open fields, hedgerows, and glimpses of rural Cornwall.
ai.safety_notes: This is an easy, relatively short walk, but conditions can change with weather. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and a weather-appropriate layer. Check for muddy patches after rain and take care on uneven surfaces. Bring water, snacks, and a map or GPS; carry a charged mobile phone in case of emergency. Mind farm gates and livestock; close gates behind you. Stay on marked paths, and be cautious near road crossings and driveways. In winter daylight is limited—plan accordingly.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight boots
Bottoms appropriate for mud (pants that can be rolled up)
Map or offline GPS / smartphone with battery
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with the best conditions typically from late spring to early autumn when daylight is longer and weather is milder. Spring and autumn offer pleasant scenery and fewer crowds.
